holidays.name: New Year's Day
holidays.description: New Year's Day marks the start of a new year in the Gregorian calendar, the official calendar used in the United Kingdom.

holidays.name: 2nd January (substitute day)
holidays.description: January 2 is an annual bank holiday and the last day of the Hogmanay (New Year) celebrations in Scotland.

holidays.name: Epiphany
holidays.description: Epiphany marks the visit of the Magi to Jesus and celebrates the revelation of God incarnate as Jesus Christ.

holidays.name: Orthodox Christmas Day
holidays.description: Orthodox Christians in the United Kingdom celebrate the Nativity of Christ (Jesus' birth) on the Orthodox Christmas Day.

holidays.name: Orthodox New Year
holidays.description: Orthodox Christians in the United Kingdom mark the start of a new calendar year on either January 1 or 14 in the Gregorian calendar.

holidays.name: Burns Night
holidays.description: Burns Night celebrates the life and work of Robert Burns and Scottish culture in general. It is on or around January 25 each year.

holidays.name: Tu B'Shevat (Arbor Day)
holidays.description: Tu B’Shevat is known as the “New Year for Trees”, is one of the four Jewish New Years.

holidays.name: Chinese New Year
holidays.description: Chinese New Year in the United Kingdom (UK) marks the start of the New Year in the Chinese calendar.

holidays.name: Valentine's Day
holidays.description: Valentine’s Day is celebrated in the UK as a day of love and falls on February 14 every year.

holidays.name: Carnival / Shrove Tuesday
holidays.description: Shrove Tuesday is also known as Pancake Tuesday in the United Kingdom.

holidays.name: Carnival / Ash Wednesday
holidays.description: Ash Wednesday is a Christian observance in the United Kingdom. It is the first day of Lent.

holidays.name: Purim
holidays.description: Purim commemorates a time when Jewish people were saved from death around the fourth century BCE, according to the Book of Esther.

holidays.name: St. David's Day
holidays.description: People in Wales and Welsh communities around the world celebrate the life of their patron saint, St David, and the culture of their country on St David’s Day.

holidays.name: Maha Shivaratri
holidays.description: Maha Shivaratri is a Hindu holiday in the United Kingdom

holidays.name: Isra and Mi'raj
holidays.description: Isra and Mi'raj marks the night when the Prophet Mohammad traveled from Mecca to Jerusalem, ascended to heaven, and returned.

holidays.name: Mothering Sunday
holidays.description: Mothering Sunday, or Mother's Day, is traditionally a day to visit your mother church. It is now an occasion to bring gifts to your own mother.

holidays.name: St Patrick's Day
holidays.description: St Patrick's Day remembers the life and deeds of St Patrick, one of Ireland's patron saints. It also celebrates Irish culture.

holidays.name: March Equinox
holidays.description: March Equinox in the United Kingdom (London)

holidays.name: Palm Sunday
holidays.description: Palm Sunday in the United Kingdom celebrates Jesus Christ’s entry into Jerusalem. It is also the Sunday before Easter Sunday.

holidays.name: First day of Passover
holidays.description: Passover marks the Israelites' liberation from slavery and their exodus from Egypt around 3000 years ago.

holidays.name: Daylight Saving Time starts
holidays.description: Daylight Saving Time starts in the United Kingdom

holidays.name: Holi
holidays.description: Holi is a spring festival of colors celebrated by Hindus, Sikhs and others. It celebrates the triumph of good over evil and the upcoming season of spring. The festival can last up to sixteen days.

holidays.name: Maundy Thursday
holidays.description: Many Christians in the United Kingdom celebrate Maundy Thursday on the Thursday before Good Friday.

holidays.name: Good Friday
holidays.description: Good Friday is just before Easter Sunday and is a public holiday in the United Kingdom.

holidays.name: Holy Saturday
holidays.description: Holy Saturday is the day before Easter Sunday in the United Kingdom.

holidays.name: Last day of Passover
holidays.description: On the 8th and last day of Passover, Jews in the UK commemorate the Parting of the Red Sea and the Israelites' escape from Egypt.

holidays.name: Easter Sunday
holidays.description: Easter Sunday commemorates Jesus Christ's resurrection. The Easter egg hunt is one of the most popular Easter traditions

holidays.name: Easter Monday
holidays.description: Easter Monday is the day after Easter Sunday. It is a bank holiday in England, Wales and Northern Ireland but not in Scotland.

holidays.name: Easter Monday
holidays.description: Easter Monday is the day after Easter Sunday. It is a bank holiday in England, Wales and Northern Ireland but not in Scotland.

holidays.name: Yom HaShoah
holidays.description: Yom Hashoah, held on the 27th day of the month of Nisan, remembers the Holocaust victims who died during World War II.

holidays.name: Ramadan Start
holidays.description: Muslims in the United Kingdom welcome Ramadan as a period of fasting, self-evaluation, and spiritual growth.

holidays.name: Yom HaAtzmaut
holidays.description: Celebrated on the fifth day of the Jewish month of Iyar, Yom Ha’Atzmaut is Israel’s Independence Day.

holidays.name: Stephen Lawrence Day
holidays.description: Stephen Lawrence Day is an annual observance in the UK commemorating the racially motivated murder of Stephen Lawrence.

holidays.name: St. George's Day
holidays.description: St George's Day in England is a celebration of Saint George, a Christian martyr and soldier in the Roman army.

holidays.name: Shakespeare Day
holidays.description: National Shakespeare Day, also known as Shakespeare Day, is annually held on April 23.

holidays.name: Lag B'Omer
holidays.description: Jewish people observe Lag BaOmer on the 18th day of the month of Iyar in the Jewish calendar.

holidays.name: Orthodox Good Friday
holidays.description: Many Orthodox Christians in the United Kingdom remember the events leading up to Jesus Christ's crucifixion on Great Friday, also known as Holy Friday.

holidays.name: Orthodox Holy Saturday
holidays.description: Many Orthodox Christians in the United Kingdom remember Jesus Christ’s burial and his descent into Hades on Holy Saturday.

holidays.name: Orthodox Easter
holidays.description: Many Orthodox Christians in the United Kingdom commemorate Jesus Christ’s resurrection on Easter Day, also known as Pascha.

holidays.name: Orthodox Easter Monday
holidays.description: Many Orthodox churches in the United Kingdom observe Easter Monday on the day after the Orthodox Easter Sunday date.

holidays.name: Early May Bank Holiday
holidays.description: May Day, or the Early May Bank holiday, is on the first Monday of May each year.

holidays.name: Laylatul Qadr (Night of Power)
holidays.description: Laylatul Qadr, the Night of Power, is the holiest day of the Islamic calendar year.

holidays.name: Ascension Day
holidays.description: Ascension Day is the 40th day of Easter and commemorates Jesus Christ’s ascension into heaven, according to Christian belief.

holidays.name: Eid ul Fitr
holidays.description: Eid ul-Fitr is a Muslim celebration that marks the end of the month-long fast of Ramadan.

holidays.name: Shavuot
holidays.description: Shavuot, also known as the Festival of Weeks, is one of three major Jewish festivals celebrated among Jewish people in the UK.

holidays.name: Pentecost
holidays.description: Many Christians in the United Kingdom observe Pentecost, also known as Whitsunday or Whit Sunday.

holidays.name: Whit Monday
holidays.description: Whit Monday is a Christian observance also known as Pentecost Monday. It is the day after Pentecost, or Whitsunday.

holidays.name: Trinity Sunday
holidays.description: Trinity Sunday, which is the first Sunday after Pentecost, is a Christian feast that is observed in many churches in the United Kingdom.

holidays.name: Spring Bank Holiday
holidays.description: The spring bank holiday in the United Kingdom is on the last Monday of May each year.

holidays.name: Corpus Christi
holidays.description: Corpus Christi is a Christian observance that honors the Holy Eucharist.

holidays.name: Queen's Birthday
holidays.description: The Queen's birthday, also known as the Queen's Official Birthday, is celebrated in many Commonwealth countries around the world. It is a public holiday in countries such as Australia, New Zealand, and Gibraltar, although on different dates.

holidays.name: Father's Day
holidays.description: Father's Day in the United Kingdom honors fathers and celebrates fatherhood.

holidays.name: June Solstice
holidays.description: June Solstice in the United Kingdom (London)

holidays.name: Windrush Day
holidays.description: Windrush Day is an annual observance in the UK honoring the British Caribbean community.

holidays.name: Battle of the Boyne
holidays.description: Orangemen's Day is a bank holiday in Northern Ireland to commemorate the Battle of the Boyne.

holidays.name: Tisha B'Av
holidays.description: Tisha B’Av is a Jewish day of mourning, which falls on the ninth day of the month of Av in the Jewish calendar.

holidays.name: Eid ul Adha
holidays.description: Eid ul-Adha is an Islamic festival to remember Ibrahim's willingness to sacrifice his son to God.

holidays.name: Summer Bank Holiday
holidays.description: The summer bank holiday is on the first Monday of August in Scotland and the last Monday of August in England, Wales and Northern Ireland.

holidays.name: Muharram/Islamic New Year
holidays.description: The first day of Muharram, which is the first month in the Islamic calendar, marks the Islamic New Year.

holidays.name: Assumption of Mary
holidays.description: The feast of the Dormition or Assumption of the Blessed Virgin Mary is celebrated by some Christian denominations in the United Kingdom on August 15.

holidays.name: Ashura
holidays.description: On Ashura, many Muslims commemorate the martyrdom of Imam Husayn ibn Ali.

holidays.name: Raksha Bandhan
holidays.description: Raksha Bandhan is a Hindu holiday in the United Kingdom

holidays.name: Janmashtami
holidays.description: Janmashtami is a Hindu holiday in the United Kingdom

holidays.name: Summer Bank Holiday
holidays.description: The summer bank holiday is on the first Monday of August in Scotland and the last Monday of August in England, Wales and Northern Ireland.

holidays.name: Rosh Hashana
holidays.description: Rosh Hashanah, also spelled Rosh Hashana, is commonly known as the Jewish New Year.

holidays.name: Ganesh Chaturthi
holidays.description: Ganesh Chaturthi is a Hindu holiday in the United Kingdom

holidays.name: Yom Kippur
holidays.description: Yom Kippur is arguably the holiest of the Jewish holidays. It is celebrated in October or November.

holidays.name: First day of Sukkot
holidays.description: Sukkot is a Jewish holiday lasting 7 days. It begins on the 15th of Tishrei, which falls into September or October.

holidays.name: September Equinox
holidays.description: September Equinox in the United Kingdom (London)

holidays.name: Hoshana Rabbah
holidays.description: Jewish people in the UK celebrate Hoshana Rabbah, also spelled Hoshana Raba, on the last day of the Sukkot festival.

holidays.name: Shemini Atzeret
holidays.description: Shemini Atzeret, also spelled Shmini Atzeret, is a joyous Jewish holiday that immediately follows the Sukkot festival.

holidays.name: Simchat Torah
holidays.description: Simchat Torah (Simchas Torah or Simhat Torah) is a Jewish holiday that celebrates the completion of the annual reading of the Torah.

holidays.name: Feast of St Francis of Assisi
holidays.description: Many churches in the United Kingdom celebrate the Feast of St Francis of Assisi to honor St Francis, the patron saint of animals and the environment, on October 4 each year.

holidays.name: Navaratri
holidays.description: Navaratri is a Hindu holiday in the United Kingdom

holidays.name: Dussehra
holidays.description: Dussehra is a Hindu holiday in the United Kingdom

holidays.name: Milad un Nabi (Mawlid)
holidays.description: Milad un Nabi, also called Mawlid, marks the birthday of prophet Muhammad.

holidays.name: Daylight Saving Time ends
holidays.description: Daylight Saving Time ends in the United Kingdom

holidays.name: Halloween
holidays.description: Halloween is an observance celebrated at the end of October by holding parties, dressing up and going 'trick-or-treating'.

holidays.name: All Saints' Day
holidays.description: Many Christians in the United Kingdom observe All Saints' Day, also known as All Hallows' Day, each year.

holidays.name: All Souls' Day
holidays.description: All Souls’ Day is observed among some Christian communities in the United Kingdom on November 2 each year.

holidays.name: Diwali/Deepavali
holidays.description: Diwali, also known as the Festival of Lights, marks the beginning of the Hindu New Year.

holidays.name: Guy Fawkes Day
holidays.description: Guy Fawkes' Night, or Bonfire Night, commemorates the prevention of a plot to blow up the Houses of Parliament in London in 1605.

holidays.name: Remembrance Sunday
holidays.description: The United Kingdom observes Remembrance Day to remember those who sacrificed their lives during wars and conflicts, including World War I.

holidays.name: First Sunday of Advent
holidays.description: The first Sunday in Advent is the start of the liturgical or church year for many Christians as well as the Christmas season for people in the United Kingdom (UK).

holidays.name: First Day of Hanukkah
holidays.description: Jewish people around the world celebrate Hanukkah to commemorate an event traditionally termed the miracle of the cruse of oil.

holidays.name: St Andrew's Day
holidays.description: St Andrew is the patron saint of Scotland and St Andrew's Day is a bank holiday in Scotland.

holidays.name: Last day of Hanukkah
holidays.description: The eighth and last day of Hanukkah marks the end of a period in which Jews commemorate the miracle of the cruse of oil.

holidays.name: Feast of the Immaculate Conception
holidays.description: The Feast of the Immaculate Conception celebrates the conception of Mary, mother of Jesus Christ, on December 8 each year.

holidays.name: December Solstice
holidays.description: December Solstice in the United Kingdom (London)

holidays.name: Christmas Eve
holidays.description: Christmas Eve is the day before Christmas Day. It is not a public holiday in England, Scotland, Wales or Northern Ireland.

holidays.name: Christmas Day
holidays.description: Christmas Day is a holiday that traditionally celebrates Jesus Christ's birth. It is on December 25 in the United Kingdom.

holidays.name: Boxing Day
holidays.description: Boxing Day is a holiday in the United Kingdom that falls on December 26 each year.

holidays.name: Substitute Bank Holiday for Christmas Day
holidays.description: December 27 is a bank holiday in the United Kingdom only in some years, depending on which day Christmas Day or Boxing Day occur.

holidays.name: Substitute Bank Holiday for Boxing Day
holidays.description: December 28 is a bank holiday in the United Kingdom only in some years, depending on which day Christmas Day or Boxing Day occur.

holidays.name: New Year's Eve
holidays.description: New Year's Eve, or Hogmanay in Scotland, is the last day of the year in the Gregorian calendar.
